title: If I'm a peasant in southern France during the 900s AD, am I aware of who the current king is? Do I even know there is a king? - Quora

response.answer_text: If I'm a peasant in southern France during the 900s AD, am I aware of who the current king is? Do I even know there is a king? AFAIR, such a peasant would not even be the subject of a “King of France”. He will care more about who’s the local ruler, duke, count or baron, because whatever guy rules in Paris, he definitely cannot influence the south more like said local ruler. And of course he would be much more interested about what happens on the other side of the Pyrenees (Moors, Arab kingdoms) and perhaps Italy (as a region, bot a state).

You know there is a king, though your contact with him is limited to coins in all likelihood. You know his name and that's about all you know, unless he was known for something that has been spread throughout the land.
